Title: Data Analyst
Description: About the job JOB SUMMARY Dashing Diva is seeking a proactive and analytical Data Analyst to leverage large data sets to deliver powerful intelligence and insights and develop tools to support strategic opportunities and drive revenue. The Data Analyst directly reports to the MIS Manager and works closely with the Supply Chain, Product, and Marketing Team. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Work with the stakeholders to understand the business & reporting needs – Propose, design, and develop creative dashboard solutions that provide required insight, and improve/automate processes Develop and perform data extraction, transformation, and load (ETL) and automation, define and evaluate metrics, monitor key business metrics and their progress against goals, and understand root causes of changes in metrics Build reports and visualizations on a periodic basis to support various teams such as Supply Chain, Sales, Product, E-commerce, and Marketing Perform data analysis, validation, cleansing, and manipulation using SQL, Python, or other tools Design, implement, and maintain data warehouse systems and related data marts towards the delivery of business requirements Forecast product demands and market trends using time series analysis and support to build purchasing, sales, and inventory plans QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or equivalent technical field A minimum of 2 years of direct experience in custom ETL design, implementation, and maintenance Working proficiency level in programming languages: SQL, Python, and/or R, and visualization tools: Tableau and/or Power BI Proficient with cloud-based database systems and environments Excellent communication skills for collaborating with other teams Possess strong business acumen and problem-solving skills on various projects Organized, detail-oriented, self-motivated with minimal supervision, and adaptable in a fast-paced, often changing environment Bilingual preferred (Kor/Eng) Location: Port Washington, NY | Onsite Job Type: Full-time | Exempt Salary Range: $60,000~$80,000 per year The base pay offered varies depending on multiple factors, such as market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and years of experience. Dashing Diva is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender identity, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other classification protected by Federal, State or Local law

Title: ASSOCIATE ANALYST, SEM
Description: The Associate Analyst, SEM will be responsible for day to day management of assigned accounts including campaign creation, optimizations, reporting, and QA. They will be working alongside media, analytics, and other account teams to ensure campaigns are fully integrated. The person in this role will also assist senior search team members perform keyword research, competitive analysis and planning for client campaigns. This role reports in to the Supervisor, Associate Director or Director of Search  EngineMarketing.RESPONSIBILITIES: Build expertise in leading ad technology platforms such as Google Search Ads 360 (DoubleClick), The Trade Desk, and utilize platforms to manage campaigns Outline account structure including match types, ad group, keywords, landing pages, ad extensions and create ad copy to match search queries Pull and review search query reports to mine for additional keywords and negative keywords Assist in the optimization of assigned paid search, video, contextual and programmatic accounts by running diagnostic reports, identifying red flags and/or opportunities, and making optimizations that drive campaign delivery, reach, and performance Analyze performance data and implement optimizations to increase ROI of campaigns Partner with assigned teams to execute A/B landing page and creative ad testing Maintain budget and spend allocation for campaigns based on set goals. Tenaciously troubleshoot and escalate technical issues. Assist in the development of bidding strategies and creation of bid management rules in paid search management tools such as Google Search Ads 360 (DoubleClick) Launch, manage, and optimize programmatic campaigns in demand side platforms like the Trade Desk. Build bulksheets, create tracking URLs and launch campaigns Partner with analytics in the completion of performance reports Perform competitive research analysis for all campaigns Stay abreast of new tools, ad formats, trends and best practices in Search and Emerging Media through research and/or industry events and conferences Create, format and update Med Legal submission documents for assigned accounts Regularly coordinate with vendors and Reps on collaborative recommendations for optimization and management Education, Certifications, Specialized Training: Ability to multitask Detail oriented Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills PC proficiency and solid working knowledge of MS Office particularly Excel, basic knowledge of pivot tables and V-Lookups Knowledge of Web Analytics software, such as Omniture, WebTrends, Google Analytics and bid management tools like Google Search Ads 360 (Doubleclick) or The Trade Desk a plus Healthcare/Pharmaceutical background a plus Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, preferably in Marketing, Business, or any related fields

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Role: Data Analyst Source Mix: FTC. Location: Columbus, OH Local candidates OR (Within 45 Miles from client location) RTTO: Day One Onsite Job Description: Data Analyst :- Drive the definition, design and delivery of new data products within the customer’s Data Platform and related applications Work with Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Data analysts as a single Agile scrum teams on design, definition, documentation and implementation of features for new applications, business infrastructure, data security, and data structures  Document and enter user stories in Jira and assist in story point analyses Document monitor and revise the following artifacts in support of application development: product requirements, process maps, use cases, user acceptance test plans, project plans, and release notes.   Create product strategy documents/PRDs that describe business cases, high-level use cases, technical requirements and ROI   Coordinate and participate in user acceptance testing of functional requirements.   Develop, update and implement standard operating procedures for deliverables including Reports, Analysis, Presentations and Technical Deliverables.   Interpret and prioritize business needs across various stakeholders group including other Product Managers, Business Analytics and CDM  Define and track key success metrics and SLAs on the key data products and services Ideal candidate will have following Background and Skills: Ability to handle ambiguity and fast-paced environment. Prior experience in managing Director+ level stakeholders a plus.   Hands-on experience with SQL and Python Ability to formulate project strategy & roadmap through Metrics and Data-driven approach. Ability to pick-up new technology trends and vocabulary of Big-data Tech stack in a short amount of time. Strong analytics and structured problem-solving skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Position: Data Analyst (1 Mid-level, 1 Senior level) Location: Onsite Monday – Friday for the 1st 90 days (after 90 days will be hybrid 2 days remote) Must Haves: Strong analytical skills – ability to read and write complex SQL queries Experience with data visualization tools (power BI, OBIEE, etc.) – strong storytelling skills Hands on experience with excel (vlook ups, pivot tables, building excel charts and excel reports) Day-to-Day: Insight Global is looking for a Data Analyst for a permanent opportunity located in Miami, FL. You will be joining a very collaborative team of 5 and will be responsible for building excel charts and reports focused on revenue and sales for 20 different resorts. Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Executing existing reporting and analytical responsibilities. Leveraging data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests. Presents findings in easily understood ways, focusing on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture. Utilizes multiple sources of data to analyze and resolve problems. Works closely with stakeholders to understand their data and reporting needs. Assists in developing and implementing data collection systems and data analytics strategies. Performs data cleansing, transformation, and validation to ensure data accuracy and integrity. Conducts statistical analysis and data modeling to uncover insights and patterns. -Position: SR. Data Analyst Location: Onsite Monday – Friday for the 1st 90 days (after 90 days will be hybrid 2 days remote) Must Haves: Strong analytical skills – ability to read and write complex SQL queries Hands on experience with relational database concepts (Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata) SQL & Oracle Tables Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, OBIEE, etc.) – strong storytelling skills for technical and non-technical audiences Building, linking, and implementing Power BI) Hands on experience with excel (vlook ups, pivot tables, building excel charts and excel reports) Plusses: Experience & background working in a Travel Leisure environment Experience with Medallia Day-to-Day: Insight Global is looking for a SR. Data Analyst for a permanent opportunity located in Miami, FL. You will be joining a very collaborative team of 5 and will be responsible for supporting high level projects focused on 20 different resorts. Within this role you will develop, support, and automate performance reports/dashboards to help monitor performance, identify anomalies, and evaluate business impact, as well as assist in the development of consumer models and segmentation. Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Delivering impactful insights through data analysis that will drive business strategy and operational efficiency Analyze guest behavior to identify patterns, uncover opportunities and create a common understanding of how guests interact with our brands. Collect, mine, analyze and report data from various databases and reporting sources. Build intuitive presentations, interfaces, infographics, and data visualizations to tell stories with data that convey key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across contact centers Develop new metrics and analytical approaches, measuring performance for both tactical and strategic decision-making

Title: Senior Paid Media Analyst
Description: The Role We're looking for an ambitious Senior Paid Media Analyst to join our talented Paid Media team in Phoenix. This is a fantastic opportunity for an expert in digital marketing across multiple paid media channels, campaign strategy and implementation to work with our fantastic clients and have a significant impact in our IDX journey. This role is client facing and serves as the communication point for account management, project management, and strategy teams for hands-on campaign management, performance analysis, and proactive tactical recommendations. You will support in a cross-functional role due to omni channel experience, and contribute to cohesive strategies. What You'll Be Doing Manage all aspects of paid media account management (75%) Establish omni-channel paid media strategy, own client communication, and hit performance goals Provide guidance and oversight to more junior team members (when applicable) or peers for client initiatives Work with client management team to meet reporting deadlines and aid in relevant discussion Own and/or lead campaign research, implementation, analysis, and proactive tactical recommendations; tasks include but are not limited to channel/platform expansion, budget pacing, report building, performance analysis, keyword research, Ad copy testing, audience research/building, strategic recommendations, forecasting. Work with Manager/Director on existing client opportunity and department wide deliverables (10%) Explore case study opportunities, which includes: gathering research and developing client case studies to be shared with leadership on a quarterly basis Actively involved in audience research, tactical recommendations, and strategy proposals for applicable paid media channels for new and existing clients Supports in the onboarding of new clients, across account set-up, billing, paid search audit, etc. Responsible for larger client strategic initiatives and delivering to internal team and/or client – this includes but is not limited to recommendations regarding budget, bidding, audience, copy & asset, landing page/UX testing and heavily contribute to annual planning. Google Marketing Platform and participate in training of new/junior coordinators/analysts on accounts and through shadowing (15%) Help train team members on GMP onboarding and execution Responsible for GMP in platform activations, trafficking, optimization set-up, etc. Assist in tactical research Stay on top of industry trends and available beta programs Promote positive team culture Participate in new business and marketing initiatives (5%) Assist Manager/Director in pulling competitive data and platform insights for new business opportunities About You Previous experience of paid media experience, some of which must be in a digital agency environment Expert level of knowledge of paid media channels across search, social and programmatic (2 minimum) Minimum: Google, Microsoft, YouTube, Meta, LinkedIn, Programmatic (via vendor or in-platform trader) Ideal: TikTok, Twitter, Snapchat, Pinterest Previous experience of Google Marketing Platform (at least 2 of: SA360, CM360, DV360) Working knowledge of Google Analytics Working knowledge of GTM is a plus Awareness of all digital marketing channels and their potential impact on paid media performance (Paid Social, Display & Programmatic, Amazon, Email, Organic Social Media, SEO & Content, Affiliate) Has created client forecast and omni-channel media plan and demonstrates ability to compile advanced client deliverables Successfully own paid media campaigns that reach client goals Able to work collaboratively and willing to educate team members/clients across paid media channels Experience working with B2B, B2C, and Ecommerce verticals is recommended Ability to analyze complex issues and to develop relevant and realistic plans, programs and recommendations to solve client challenges High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation Promotes team culture and brings strong enthusiasm for all of paid media Why Join Us? The Opportunity: We pride ourselves on innovative excellence and our people are at the forefront of growth and evolution. At Investis Digital (iDX) you will have the opportunity work with world class clients and make a significant impact their business while gaining experiences to grow professionally. Our People: You will work with some of the most talented people in the industry and learn from true experts in the industry Our Clients: We collaborate with the world’s leading brands. Get Involved: If you’re looking to add value outside of your day-to-day responsibilities, you’re welcome to join our DE&I and social committees, addressing a variety of topics including CSR, wellbeing, and sustainability. Our Perks: We provide all the necessary support and rewards to make your life and wellbeing comfortable, including: Hybrid work schedule with 20 days annual leave Health care benefit plan options, available on your first day! 401k retirement plan with company match Annual bonus and incentive plans, for eligible roles Paid community give-back volunteer days Regular social activities to promote team collaboration and community networking Our Working Model Our people are the forefront of our success - We embrace a culture of skilled, creative, diverse, and trailblazing professionals with a passion for excellence in everything they do. Our teams collaborate with global teams in-office and virtually to ensure delivery of the best services to our clients. We hire great talent and give them the runway to achieve greatness! An Inclusive Workplace Investis Digital (iDX) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We aim to foster an environment that desires and recruits diverse talent, cultivates a culture that celebrates all identities, life experiences, perspectives, and ensures equal opportunity for all.

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description: Role Description Hi there, thanks for checking out the Jr. Data Analyst role at ! This role is based in our NYC office. The salary for this role is $70k per year plus stock options. Only applications submitted through the following link will be considered: Are you ready for an amazing career opportunity? Are you a data-driven problem solver? As a Jr. Data Analyst at MealPal, you will drive meaningful insights to help inform the business strategy. You will manage weekly and monthly KPIs, build reports and dashboards, and create processes to ensure we use data to make impactful business decisions. Responsibilities: Generate, maintain, and automate reporting Mine data for answers to business challenges Develop insights and recommend business strategy based on data Share data in a digestible way with the entire company Define best practices and new processes to collect, analyze, and manage data Requirements: This is an entry level role ideal for a spring 2024 grad in computer science, engineering, or similar fields Python, SQL coding and Excel skills Logical, problem-solving mentality Strong communication skills Compensation: Competitive base salary Meaningful equity and the opportunity to build something 401(k) with Employer Match Health, Vision, & Dental benefits (healthcare is 100% covered by MealPal) Paid vacation time Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate team Only applications submitted through the following link will be considered:

Title: Data Analyst IV (Healthcare Financial Analytics)
Description: You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility. Position Purpose Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes. Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data. Lead the planning and execution of large-scale projects and new reporting tools, translating business goals into actionable solutions Identify and resolve data, process, and technical issues and communicate root-cause with stakeholders as appropriate Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners Independently engage with business leaders to understand market-specific levers and constraints Leverage enterprise reporting tools to rapidly deliver data-driven insights and recommendations Research key business problems and proactively identify opportunities for cost and utilization improvements through quantitative analysis Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required Mentor junior analysts on analytic best practices and business need fulfilment. Delegate tasks to junior analysts, providing guidance and validation where required Education/Experience Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. Master's degree preferred. 5+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management or 3+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Experience with table creation and indexing, query optimization, and utilization of stored procedures. Working knowledge of SQL/querying languages. Experience with table creation and indexing, query optimization, and utilization of stored procedures. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI. SAS strongly preferred. Our Comprehensive Benefits Package Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development. Pay Range $82,600.00 - $148,700.00 per year Actual pay will be adjusted based on an individual's skills, experience, education, and other job-related factors permitted by law. Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Company Description BLEND360 is an award-winning, new breed Data Science Solutions Company focused on powering exceptional results to our Fortune 500 clients. We are a growing company—born at the intersection of advanced analytics, data, and technology. Job Description We are currently looking for a seasoned Data Analyst to join our team. We are looking for someone who knows how to identify complex patterns in data and communicate results to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a strong data foundation and be up to date on the latest platforms, tools, and technologies (particularly R, Python and SQL). You must be able to quickly adapt to a client’s business model and build credibility as their trusted advisor. Main Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To Strong SQL skills, particularly in data reconciliation. Familiarity with ASCII and Unicode configurations is necessary, along with the ability to explain these to clients. Excellent communication skills, a customer service background, and the ability to translate technical to business language. Communicate results/findings to senior leadership, including non-technical stakeholders. Analyze data to identify anomalies. Strong problem-solving skills with ability to frame the problem and execute analysis independently. Qualifications BS in Computer Science or related field. MS a plus 3-5 years of corporate experience as a Data Analyst. Analytical And Problem-Solving Skills Deep analytical skills and the ability to see the patterns within data. Problem-solving and decision-making skills to identify anomalies and communicate findings from varied / inconsistent data sets. Technical Background Technical background with experience in analytics, data science, database, or development. Strong SQL and either R or Python expertise Solid ML and data analysis skills – ability to apply appropriate techniques. Communication Skills. Experience working with a variety of stakeholders. Stakeholders can range from front-line team members up to the C-Suite, and they include a variety of roles. Communication skills are essential to ensure that the client, Blend360 team, and any other stakeholders are aligned. Additional Information The starting pay range for this role is $58- $62 per hour. Actual compensation within the range will be dependent on several factors including but not limited to relevant experience, skills, certifications, training, and location. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range and determining factors for compensation are considered for each individual circumstance. BLEND360 also offers a competitive benefits program to meet the health and financial well-being of our team and their families. You can look forward to a range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401K, PTO, paid holidays, commuter benefits, spending accounts, life insurance, disability coverage, and EAPs. A diverse workforce is a strong workforce To deliver growth at BLEND360 and for our clients, we believe as a Talent Solutions Company, we have a responsibility and unique opportunity to positively impact the workforce. Diversity has played a critical role in our history, our growth, and continues to have a profound impact on our success._ We are determined to have equality in the workplace, within our team and as an extension of our clients’ team. This is not the work of the moment, and this requires continued learning and purposeful actions._ We are investing resources to understand and improve the sourcing, selection, and retention of the talent we hire, and ultimately the workforce we provide for our clients. We will communicate our journey in the spirit of transparency and shared learning.

Title: Marketing Analyst
Description: avad3 Event Production is looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Marketing Analyst to work within our Sales and Marketing department. About This Role At avad3, finding the right clients is one of our top priorities. The Marketing Analyst is entrusted to execute direct response marketing tactics across a variety of media channels. This position will work closely with Marketing and Sales team members to conduct continuous testing and analysis to increase lead volume, improve conversion rate, optimally target advertising campaigns, reactivate existing clients, and create nuanced client pathways to providing the best user experience. THE PERFECT FIT You have experience working in Digital Marketing and/or Sales and you love the possibility of working with a growing production company that prioritizes a healthy work culture and creates unique experiences for staff through the nature of the work being done. The idea of learning the job, mastering it, and continuing to flourish in a position that you’ve made your own truly appeals to you! Primary Responsibilities Marketing Technology Stack: Exhibit proficiency and willingness to learn marketing software and tools (e.g., marketing automation, email marketing platforms, CRM systems) Be proactive in proposing new ideas and approaches Digital advertising: Manage advertising campaigns, conduct research and execute new paid media campaigns, prioritizing top performing channels Quality Control: Ensure accuracy, consistency, and quality in all content produced Metrics and Reporting: Analyze performance metrics to measure the effectiveness of content initiatives and work with the Marketing Director to provide insights for continuous improvement Team Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate content into marketing campaigns and events, ensuring a cohesive brand message Requirements REQUIREMENTS 3-5 years of experience in a relevant marketing analytics role preferred Ability to work with data to identify key performance trends Understanding of CRM concepts, social media tactics and email marketing platforms Conduct database management for data hygiene, and data enrichment activities Able to work independently as well as in a strong collaborative environment Strong with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and maintain data integrity and integrations Preferred Experience Our ideal candidate will have prior marketing analytics experience, in-depth knowledge of Salesforce Marketing Cloud and working on or with a Digital team to expand Customer Experiences through new technologies. This individual will need to have a strong skill set in managing requirements and ensuring solutions meet user or business expectations. Production Experience Proven track record of meeting or exceeding quotas and receiving positive client feedback Proficiency with MarketingOS or SalesOS COMPETENCIES Development - Be gifted in teaching others Problem solving - Have experience managing projects and problem-solving from concept formation to completion Detail-oriented - Skilled at managing details, processes and information flow Initiative - Self-starter. Able to work without direct supervision Communication - Has excellent written and verbal communication skills Teachable - Humble and ready to learn Energetic - Loves to hustle. Comfortable in a fast-paced environment Trustworthy - Ability to maintain regular and punctual attendance. Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness. Follows instructions, responds to management direction; completes tasks on time or notifies the appropriate person with an alternate plan Benefits BENEFITS 401K Retirement with 6% match Company-paid 60% healthcare benefits Paid personal days starting at 20 days per year Company-issued Apple MacBook Computer Annual company offsite days, Christmas Party and fun times as a team! About Our CompanyWe are a national event production company, with our sole office proudly based in our hometown of Northwest Arkansas. We make flawless production scalable, serving event planners on their biggest days of their year by managing production. We support non-profits, agencies, Fortune 500 companies and educational clients for over one hundred of their events each year. We believe no message should be distracted by technical difficulties. We’re a small business and a tight-knit team that values joy at work and a passion for what we do.About Our CommunityWe are definitely biased when we say Northwest Arkansas is an ideal place to live and work. Although our operations take us all over the United States, avad3 will always call Northwest Arkansas home. Three Fortune 500 companies are headquartered here, and countless others have offices. The University of Arkansas, Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art, and the Walton Arts Center provide a rich educational and cultural backdrop, and our location in the heart of the Ozarks near the Buffalo River and Devil’s Den State Park creates a surplus of riches when it comes to outdoor opportunities. An extensive trail system and the active mountain biking and running communities make NWA a favorite of amateur and professional athletes alike. We have an excellent national airport providing direct flights to over 20 US cities. Our diverse population provides an atmosphere where there is always something new to experience and always space to thrive.

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description: Workwear Outfitters has a strong legacy of building innovative and authentic market-right products and is a leading supplier of work apparel and footwear for diverse occupations in industries such as automotive, manufacturing, oil and gas, utilities, government, food services, telecommunications, hospitality, and many more. Workwear Outfitters is based in Nashville, Tennessee with over $800 million in sales and we employ more than 5,800 people in facilities spanning the globe. Brands under the Workwear Outfitters umbrella include Red Kap®, Bulwark®, Image Authority®, Kodiak®, Terra®, Walls®, Liberty ®, Work Authority®, Workrite® Fire Service, Chef Designs®, and Horace Small®. Workwear Outfitters is also the exclusive licensee for Dickies® apparel in the B2B channel. Our Purpose: “We champion and empower workers who make our world work better” Major benefits include medical, vision and dental, Life and Disability coverage. Other benefits included: 401K, Tuition reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, and many others. What You Will Do as a Data Analyst: The Data Analyst works with the WWOF Digital team to leverage analytical and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions. This role will help to establish data-driven decisions by developing key reports and dashboards that allow us to know our consumers and our retail/wholesale functions while taking advantage of the most modern visualizations. This role will also work closely with power users across business units to create and guide our self-service analytics practice. Our ideal candidate has experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, IBM Cognos Analytics, IBM Planning Analytics, SQL, and advanced Excel skills. A successful individual in this role is flexible, can prioritize competing objectives, can operate independently, and leads analytical projects. How You Will Make a Difference: Develop Reporting process and schedule for WWOF Digital business Own all reporting for rapidly Growing and developing ecommerce business Responsible for Digital reporting for 6 Workwear Outfitter brands Walls, Liberty Bibs, Red Kap, Bulwark, Kodiak, Terra. Will also own reporting for Amazon.com and all Wholesale.com business Interacts across Business, Marketing, Finance, Merchandising, and Operations team Main duties include identifying, gathering, analyzing data and making insights accessible to the company through easy-to-understand graphs, charts, tables and reports Troubleshooting, identifying problems and working with Merchandising, Marketing, Digital, Operations teams to resolve Promotion and campaign performance evaluation, measurement, reporting Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements Document and trend over time the state of current and future capabilities about business processes, data platform technology, etc... Able to work proactively without significant guidance or direction to trouble shoot and problem -solve. Implements innovative processes and procedures to increase department efficiencies, improve organization, and enhance services provided. Skills for Success: Highly developed organizational skills, self-motivated with initiative, able to multi-task, and meet deadlines. Able to establish and maintain effective working relationships with the business community, internal and external stakeholders, and team members. Must maintain a high sense of ownership and be able to work with a direction instead of being task oriented. Proactive communication skills (written and oral) are critical to the role’s success as it interfaces heavily with cross-functional team members and stakeholders. Ability to learn or experience in to researching data relationships, designing data models, and combining data sources. Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. Bachelor’s degree preferred; relevant experience considered. 3-5 years of System/IT/Data/Analytics experience This position is fully remote, but the candidate must be local to the Nashville Metropolitan area and able to come onsite as-needed.

Title: Business Analyst – Marketing
Description: Company Overview Milo’s Tea Company is one of the fastest growing beverage companies in the US. Our culture and operations are built on the belief that we can make a difference in the world. That’s why we put People First and strive to continually reduce our environmental impact on the planet. We leverage our world class operations and decades-long distribution partnerships to grow the footprint of our core products and create new, innovative beverage products. We are the #1 and fastest growing brand in the Refrigerated Tea Category in the nation. Our core mission is that we put people and the planet first and by doing this, it will be good for our business. We are committed to unlocking the personal genius of every associate and have a strong focus on growth and learning. Our Company is women-led and strongly committed to Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging. We are committed to annual charitable giving by delivering upon our 1% profit pledge. We are Platinum Certified in Zero Waste Manufacturing; recycling, reducing, and reusing 95% of waste at our facilities. By being a part of the Milo’s TEAm, you’ll get to collaborate with a group of passionate and high-performing people, where everyone feels empowered to do their best work and feels good about the work they’re doing. And as a "People First" company, Milo’s is committed to the success and well-being of our associates, customers, and fans, no matter their gender, race, or creed. Some of the great things offered that reflect our commitment include: Competitive salary with bonus opportunities for various roles 100% paid medical insurance for our associates and their families Free Mental Health, Financial Wellness, and Legal Counseling benefits 401K with a company match Company-paid Life Insurance Robust Wellness Program Tuition reimbursement assistance Continuous learning opportunities through various platforms and resources Paid parental leave benefit Care Relief Fund to help Associates in need Associate Assistance Program Paid volunteer time Position Summary Translates market research, consumer behavior, and marketing performance metrics to drive incremental growth, enhance consumer experiences, and maximize the effectiveness of marketing campaigns. Ownership Analyze marketing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Interpret data to provide actionable recommendations for marketing strategies. Develops key performance indicators (KPIs) and dashboards to track and measure performance of marketing campaigns and initiatives, to improve effectiveness. Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency through data quality checks and validation processes. Creates visualizations to present complex marketing data in a clear and concise manner . I nvest in and is an example of Milo’s Responsibility commitment which includes environmental, social, and corporate governance components. The position has Food Safety Responsibilities. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Bachelor's Degree, and minimum 3 years of experience in marketing and/or media planning analytics utilizing various tools and platforms. Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, lifts, days of supply and percentages. Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, vlookups , etc.). Ability to analyze marketing metrics, performance data, and trends to derive actionable insights. Familiarity with databases, CRM systems, and data visualization tools. Understanding of digital marketing channels, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, etc.

Title: Data Analyst – 2024
Description: Role Description About The TerraCotta Group: The TerraCotta Group is a private investment firm that specializes in commercial real estate (CRE) credit. Founded in 2004, TerraCotta has pioneered a unique investment approach that blends advanced data analytics with deep real estate credit experience. This distinct vision allows TerraCotta to provide custom credit secured by CRE assets.  TerraCotta’s current investment vehicle, the TerraCotta Credit Fund (“TCCF”) has a $1 Billion lending capacity focused on originating and funding senior secured bridge loans in the middle market.  Our performance track record is one of the best in the industry. About the Position: We seek to hire the best and brightest students who want to learn and grow by applying themselves to a new way of providing growth capital to sophisticated CRE investors. You will work in a collegial and merit-based environment at the intersection of data and financial credit analysis with a highly committed team of professionals who are led by visionary leadership. You will learn all aspects of CRE related data science and will assist in building out and managing an integrated data warehouse based system that supports the investment team, as well as other data science specific tasks in support of the firm’s TerraCotta Lab activities. Independent thinking is encouraged, and initiative is rewarded. Analysts play a crucial role at our firm, by applying descriptive and predictive analytics in the execution of originations, underwriting, quantitative research, due diligence, servicing, and capital markets processes. Responsibilities: Researching, designing, and maintaining data from a large number of sources to support the investment theses, grounded in statistical analyses of key economic drivers. Profiling, cleaning, and ingesting data from various data sources, using principles, tools, and techniques from the data science domain. Conducting deep data analysis to systematically understand the true meaning embedded in data, and exploring meaningful relationships therein. Building relationships and collaborating with external data vendors. Preparing financial projections & market analysis, including vacancy, absorption, and comparable rents & sales. Providing support to senior team members during the underwriting, due diligence, and servicing process of assessing commercial real estate loans. Assisting with loan portfolio management and investor reporting. Characteristics, Skills, and Education: Required Driven candidates who are looking to take end-to-end ownership of their work and make a tangible impact in the CRE credit space through the use of data science. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Desire to work in a small office with constant collaboration. Strong verbal and written communication skills. An ability to work under strict deadlines and capacity to successfully manage multiple tasks in a dynamic professional environment. “Roll up your sleeves” mindset A strong sense of curiosity and a desire to continually learn & grow as a Data Analyst. A Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or Economics (as well as other related quantitative fields). Preferred Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Experience with R, Python, & SQL. Experience with data visualization software like Tableau & PowerBI

Title: Data Driven Marketing Analyst – Creative
Description: About the jobFMCG Direct is the full-service data driven marketing agency of Deluxe Corporation – with decades-long experience helping clients gain the competitive edge they need to grow market share. Deluxe Corporation is a $2B trusted, tech-enabled solutions provider serving nearly 5 million small businesses and over 4,600 financial institutions. FMCG Direct is located in New York City (Manhattan) and this position will be starting on July, 2024. This role is an in office position.Marketing Analysts are key members of the FMCG Direct team who work with senior client management to create and execute targeted multi-channel marketing campaigns for retail banks and expanding verticals. There are two primary responsibilities for an analyst on the Creative Strategies team: 1) Serve as a primary client / vendor liaison to efficiently facilitate integrated marketing campaigns and 2) Develop marketing materials that generate superior performance in terms of marketing ROI.The firm selects analysts for their exceptional intelligence, analytical ability, technical proficiency, and communication skills. Those selected also demonstrate a high energy level, a willingness to work exceptionally hard, and a belief in personal responsibility to make their end product better.Basic Qualifications: Education and Experience: Bachelor’s in Marketing, communications, economics, social sciences, hard sciences and 0 years or HS/GED and 4 years of related experience Successfully completed coursework in marketing, communications, economics, English, journalism, writing, or other relevant field Excellent editing, proofreading, and copywriting skills;Preferred Qualifications:1+ years in professional or course work demonstrating ability to work and lead within cross-functional team environmentsHighly motivated, results-oriented, and proactive, with an interest in creating and maintaining client relationshipsDetail-oriented with the ability to manage several open projects with tight deadlinesExceptional oral and interpersonal communication skills Client-centric thinker with strong creative instincts and judgement Deluxe Corporation is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, disability, sex, age, ethnic or national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or presentation, pregnancy, genetics, veteran status or any other status protected by state or federallaw. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/DisabilityPlease view the electronic EEO is the Law Poster which serves to inform you of your equal employment

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Role Description About Applied AcademicsAt Applied Academics, we pioneered an innovative, in-house quantitative framework designed to evaluate and predict managers' performances. Through our unique approach, we work with socially significant institutional investors and the world's most skilled portfolio managers. Position OverviewWe are seeking a diligent full-time Data Analyst to join our NYC team. This role is pivotal in supporting the operational side of our R&D department, and is expected to grow in a research-centric direction. If you're passionate about financial markets and have a blend of quantitative skills, we'd love to hear from you. Key Responsibilities Data Organization and Maintenance: Streamline and uphold a comprehensive data system for hundreds of portfolio managers, ensuring data accuracy and ease of access. Performance Reporting: Design, prepare, and review detailed performance reports to provide actionable insights into manager performances. Quality Control: Spearhead the quality control process of our evaluation methodology, ensuring that our standards remain unparalleled in the industry. Collaboration: Work closely with the Research, Manager Relationship Management, and Client Service teams to optimize data utilization, contribute to ongoing research projects, and strengthen our engagements with institutional investors and portfolio managers. Continuous Improvement: Engage proactively in identification and execution of opportunities to refine our data processes and systems. Qualifications and Characteristics Master's degree in Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Financial Engineering, Mathematical Finance, or a related quantitative field. Experience or education relating to financial markets. Basic familiarity with concepts in software development such as version control, cloud computing, SQL, and the linux command line. Demonstrated experience in Python programming. Exceptional attention to detail with a knack for logical and thoughtful communication. A genuine passion for finance and data analytics. Ability to work independently and as part of a team, showcasing strong problem-solving skills. Eagerness to learn, adapt, and evolve in a fast-paced environment. Why Join Applied Academics? Be at the forefront of financial analytics innovation and work with a number of industry experts. Your contributions will work towards creating a significant impact to global institutional investors. Enjoy competitive compensation, opportunities for professional growth in research, and be an integral part of our transformative journey in the financial realm.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Role Description Job Description: As a Data Analyst you will be trained on Analytics, Data Engineering, Visualization and software applications associated and then get deployed on projects to the world class clients we serve. Campus hires begin their careers with TCS in the Initial Learning Program. A fully paid training program designed to provide you with the information and training necessary to succeed at TCS and excel at client sites. However, the learning does not stop there! TCS is committed to the continuous growth of its associates, in line with the core value of Learning & Sharing. We offer a Continuous Learning Program that spans technologies, domains, processes and soft skills. In addition, TCS associates are encouraged to undertake certifications and accreditations in a wide range of subject areas. With clients located across the US and globe, TCS can offer great flexibility in work location, excellent career advancement, and a variety of opportunities. TCS’ mentoring, career development, and on-the-job training ensure a smooth transition into your professional life and orient you to our culture, values, vision, and mission. Role:   Data Analysts Job type: Full time Position Description General data engineering, ETLs, complex querying, and analytics/BI Using SQL to take messy, disparate data and engineer it to create tables clean enough to support statistical and ML pipelines. Translate non-technical business requirements into statistical data/feature design Engineering data tables specifically to support statistical/ML modeling Building models using Pandas, Numpy, and statistical/ML packages Forecasting, and forecast volatility analysis Building business optimization tools based on analytical understanding of volatility Work on Tableau, Data Studio, Etc.,

Title: Data Analyst II
Description: PURPOSE AND SCOPE: Under the direction of the Senior Director, Knowledge Management and Analytics, takes necessary actions to ensure the efficient and timely preparation of routine reports, clinical analyses and data extracts to support various departments within the organization. Responsible for creating actionable claims-based analytics to support the company's partnerships with Accountable Care organizations and other strategic arrangements. Other clinical analytics and project based analytical efforts including data science efforts may be assigned PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Generates reports and data extracts for Executive Operations, Quality Management, Advanced analytics and research from both external and internal data sources. Create actionable trend information, and ensure that internal members of the company have the information necessary to make informed business, operating, and research decisions. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Ensure all data analysis requests are conducted in compliance with HIPAA and other pertinent regulatory requirements. Ensure the appropriate timeliness, usability and accuracy of the reports. Develops in-depth technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity. Work is performed with limited direction. Exercises increasing latitude in determining technical objectives of each assignment. Investigates complex data related issues and synthesizes quantitative and qualitative information using past, current, and future trending information Complete assignments on time and within budget Review and comply with the Code of Business Conduct and all applicable company policies and procedures, local, state and federal laws and regulations. Assist with various projects as assigned by a direct supervisor. Other duties as assigned. Additional responsibilities may include focus on one or more departments or locations. See applicable addendum for department or location specific functions. PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions EDUCATION: Master's Degree required; preferably in a relevant filed (examples are Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Biology. Some clinical training a plus. EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED SKILLS: 3-4 years' related work experience Must have experience using SAS to develop complex business reports. Must have experience using R/Python Must have strong SQL skills Experience in population health or clinical analytics preferred. Ability to collaborate with colleagues to create complex analytic work products Detail oriented, with strong organizational skills Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and to meet deadlines EO/AA Employer: Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity Fresenius Medical Care North America maintains a drug-free workplace in accordance with applicable federal and state laws.

Title: Marketing Analyst
Description: Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.Job TitleMarketing Analyst What does a successful Marketing Analyst do at Fiserv? As a Marketing Analyst, you will have the opportunity to join a 2-year rotational program sponsored by Fiserv executive management. This is an early career development program designed to provide recent college graduates interested in progressing their careers in Marketing with professional development and growth opportunities that enable them to make meaningful contributions to Fiserv.The program foundation consists of a combination of diverse assignments, on-the-job training, mentorship and exposure to senior leadership with the ability to advance within the Marketing organization upon completion of the program. We are looking for participants with drive, enthusiasm, and an evolving target for their careers. The best and brightest will be the framework of the company’s future, a pipeline of top talent for positions across the firm. The Marketing Analyst rotation will start in January 2024. What You Will Do Example rotations and responsibilities include: Work with the Product Marketing Director and key stakeholders across the business to execute marketing tactics to support sales pipeline and revenue growth for Fiserv solutions Develop marketing collateral (sales documentation, product videos, website copy, blog posts, and more) to drive awareness, positioning and adoption of strategic marketing programs Support social media and content marketing efforts Support sales and lead generation efforts with email and other campaigns Support the Fiserv presence at industry tradeshows and events, including the Fiserv client conference Support client retention efforts designed to reconfirm our clients’ commitment to Fiserv Support the launch of new products with end-to-end, multi-touchpoint campaigns What You Will Need To Have Recent graduate of a bachelor’s degree program in Business, Marketing, Advertising, Communications or Journalism Experience in PowerPoint, and have a technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly What Would Be Great To Have Excellent written and verbal communication Strong marketing copywriting skills Able to think strategically and tactically Detail oriented. Excellent organization skills Ability to handle diverse workloads and multiple deadlines Majors: A range of college majors are considered such as: Business, Marketing, Advertising, Communications and Journalism, but willing to train the right candidate. Please Note: Our Analyst Program interview process begins in October for a January 2024 start date. You can expect to hear from one of our recruiters if your qualifications align. This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington.Please note that salary ranges provided for this role on external job boards are salary estimates made by outside  parties and may not be accurate.Thank You For Considering Employment With Fiserv. Please Apply using your legal name Complete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable). What You Should Know About Us Fiserv is a global fintech leader with 40,000-plus (and growing) associates proudly serving clients in more than 100 countries. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company, one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, and a top scorer on Bloomberg’s Gender-Equality Index, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. Our Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce that reflects our world. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Warning About Fake Job Posts Please be aware of fraudulent job postings that are not affiliated with Fiserv. Fraudulent job postings may be used by cyber criminals to target your personally identifiable information and/or to steal money or financial information. Any communications from a Fiserv representative will come from a legitimate business email address. We will not hire through text message, social media, or email alone, and any interviews will be conducted in person or through a secure video call. We won’t ask you for sensitive information nor will we ask you to pay anything during the hiring process. We also won’t send you a check to cash on Fiserv’s behalf.If you see suspicious activity or believe that you have been the victim of a job posting scam, you should report it to your local FBI field office or to the FBI’s Internet Crime Complaint Center.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Airdrop is a venture capital and technology company. The starting salary for this role is above $225,000. As a Data Analyst you'll be working on identifying and building technology products that help make the ecosystem of building extraordinary companies possible. This job requires someone who is good at synthesizing vast amounts of structured and unstructured data. What You'll Do Design: Design a dashboard that easy for our team to understand our companies better Build: Use python to build a system that synthesizes vasts amounts of data into a dashboard Maintain: Whatever you build will need continuous maintenance and new features Requirements Python (Django, Flask) You provide smart research with insightful analysis You pay attention to minuscule detail You are gritty and resilient You solve hard problems You win against all odds Airdrop is an equal-opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. If you are someone passionate to work on problems that matter, we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Performance Marketing Analyst
Description: We have one goal. To manufacture, launch and deliver an uncompromising, best-in-class 4x4 for those who depend on a vehicle as a working tool. We're building the Grenadier from the ground up, component by component. No corners cut and no easy options. It's been an exciting journey since our inception in 2017 hitting the huge milestone of starting production in 2022. 2023 will be another big year as we launch to our global markets. We have assembled a team of world-class experts who roll up their sleeves and get stuck in and we are looking for more doers that think big. More thinkers that dive in and do. More people that make things happen. We're a diverse workforce of tenacious, straight-talking experts and we are looking for spirited innovators who thrive in a challenge. If you are looking to join a scale-up business and take on a fulfilling and career-defining role, then let's talk. The Role: Performance Marketing Analyst The Marketing Performance Analyst will assist in the delivery of the digital marketing strategy for INEOS Automotive. Managing partner agencies to develop and implement media plans and advertisements across digital channels to drive potential customers to the INEOS Automotive website. The individual will also bring the SEO strategy to life in collaboration with partner agencies and work with various sponsorship companies to drive traffic from their digital platforms to the INEOS Automotive website, to positively impact the engagement, conversion rates and generate sales. Duties of the Performance Marketing Analyst: Support on shaping overall PPC (Pay-per-click) strategy to help maximise commercial performance Developing and owning the day to day management of the PPC marketing agency to ensure campaigns are planned, executed, and optimised in line with business requirements Deliver the search engine optimization strategy and execute the SEO roadmap for global websites Work closely with internal and external key stakeholders to drive SEO best practices, inclusive of technical SEO requirements For our Performance Marketing Analyst we are looking for: Digital Marketing experience for a well-established media agency or brand Up-to-date knowledge with the latest digital marketing and wider marketing trends and commercial best practice Has coordinated several agencies to successfully complete multiple projects SEO, PPC, website analytics experience with an understanding of how they integrate to meet brand and tactical objectives Experience working with multiple markets/regions outside of the UK SEO and media buying for e-commerce websites If the role sounds of interest and you want to learn more please apply. Please include a covering letter that supports your application along with any other supporting information. If your application is successful one of the team will be in touch to arrange an initial conversation!

Title: Entry-Level Corporate Marketing Analyst
Description: Role Description Corporate Marketing Analyst The Chicago Headquarters office is located in Itasca, IL KEYENCE is seeking a Corporate Marketing Analyst to assist with the execution and operations of its ongoing marketing activities.  Must have a high degree of attention to detail, a strong ability to analyze, organize, prioritize, and execute diverse sets of projects and tasks in a fast-paced, professional environment. As we constantly look for areas to improve, our ideal team member has a passion for learning and identifying such opportunities along the way. Responsibilities and DutiesOpportunity to assist with KEYENCE’s ongoing digital (SEO, PPC, Web), email, social media and/or trade show management and optimization.Work closely with division managers and marketing teams to implement improvements and execute various new projects Coordinate projects to ensure timely and smooth implementation Proactively identify areas to improve the company operation efficiency and initiate projects to achieve such improvements Requirements and Qualifications Highly proficient in Microsoft-based programs, particularly ExcelMust possess a high degree of attention to detailAbility to work individually as well as in a team setting, often under deadline pressureAbility to handle confidential, sensitive informationAbility to travel up to 25%Must possess strong organizational and communication skillsAbility to prioritize and organize for on-time completion of multiple tasks and projectsWhy work for KEYENCE?Competitive compensation & benefitsPAID training & development programRecognized by Forbes World’s Top 100 as “Most Innovative” company 8 years in a row Promote from Within CultureMedical, Dental, Vision & other voluntary benefitsTotal Compensation (including incentives): $72,895KEYENCE is an at-will, Equal Opportunity Employer. The Company does not sponsor applicants for work visa.
